Cardiac Arrest.text: Check for responsiveness by asking questions and pinching their shoulders.
Tilt their headlock and check their airway.
Check for normal breathing. Look for a normal gentle rise of chest and listen for breath.
Interlock hands, lean over, and push using the heel of your palm at a depth of ~2 inches and at a rate of 100-120 beats per minute. Allow the chest to rise back to normal position between pushes.
Tilt head back pinch nose and open up air way. Form a seal over their mouth with your mouth and give 2 rescue breaths.
Switch with another person if you get tired.

Anaphylaxis.text: Form a fist around epipen and keep fingers and thumb away from either end. Hold the epipen so the blue is pointed upwards and the orange is pointed downwards.
Pull off the blue safety release
Place the orange end against the outer mid-thigh(midway between hip and knee joints) at a 90 degree angle.
While holding the leg still push down hard until a click is heard or felt and hold firmly in place for 3 seconds.
Remove the epipen and the orange end will extend over the needle.

Asthma.text: Shake the inhaler for 10 seconds then take off the cap
Sit or stand up straight and breathe out all the way
Slightly tilt your head back and put the inhaler mouthpiece into mouth above the tongue.
At the same time, press down on the inhaler and breathe in through your mouth deeply for 3-5 seconds. Make sure to keep your lips closed around the mouthpiece.
Remove the inhaler and hold your breath for 10 seconds
Breathe out slowly through your mouth
Wait 1 minute and repeat if taking more than one puff. Rinse your mouth with water and spit before repeating

Seizure.text: From lying on their back, turn the patient to the left.
Bend their knee and hip, and position the top leg in front of the patient.
Place their left arm under the patient’s head. The arm should be straight.
Adjust the head and position their mouth downward.

Choking.text: Tilt the person forward and place your arms around the person.
Form fist and place into the center of their abdomen place other hand over fist.
Pull in and up 5 times in hard quick thrusts to force air out of the lungs and blow out the obstruction.

Deep Cut.text: Place the tourniquet 2-3 inches above the wound.
Pull the strap as tight as possible and fasten the velcro 3/4 of the way.
Tighten by turning the rod. When you can no longer tighten, place rod into clamp and secure it.
Pull rest of the strap and place velcro strap over to secure.

Burn.text: Run under cold water for 10 min.
Cover the burn with cling film to prevent infection.

General First Aid Care.text: Check for any danger before approaching. Don’t get injured yourself.
Check for any response from the injured by asking questions. Gently shake their shoulders first if you don’t get a response, then try pinching their ears. AVPU: Alert, Voice, Pain, Unresponsive.
Check airways if person is unresponsive. Open airway by tilting head back with two fingers on the chin.
Check if breathing normally by placing ear over nose and mouth and looking down the body for 10 seconds.
Check for bleeding down the whole body.
